item.title: Blocked drain causing water to overflow down the road. It’s causing flooding and potholes. With winter coming this is going to become very dangerous when iced over., 30th October

item.title: The length of the Yarnolds, is a patchwork of road repairs, that dont last. The road is desperately in need of resurfacing. The are numerous potholes still to be repaired, and various previous repairs that are again broken. The road is like riding on the back of a bucking horse, even at slow speeds. There is inevitable wear and tear on vehicles due to the state of the road., 30th October
item.description:
The whole road is in desperate need of reveiw and resurfacing, which is well overdue. I could take pictures but there would be a catalogue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Yarnolds, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 30th October
item.description:
Customer reports that a branch from a (Highways) tree is hanging over the phone lines at the location and has taken out their neighbours connection - theirs is still working. They haven't reported this to BT as they have no issues. However, they do believe that the branch needs to be cut back to avoid their connection being interrupted if it falls further.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement causes rainwater to run towards house not toward kerb and road, 29th October
item.description:
4 pavement slabs outside 18 Queens Retreat and 2 pavement slabs outside 17 Queens Retreat cause rainwater to run towards houses not run towards the kerb and road. This is causing damp issues in 18 Queens Retreat and the party wall between 18 Queens Retreat and 17 Queens Retreat.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Queens Retreat, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover causing noise issues when vehicle goes over it, 29th October
item.description:
The manhole cover outside number 153 is loose and makes a loud noise when a vehicle goes over it. It’s loud enough to wake me up at night and I believe it’s loud enough for this to be a noise complaint to environmental health. The issue has been happening for over 1 month. Please respond or I will raise via local council noise complaint.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 157, Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
